title: 109_hr5297
content: The Act titled "Improving Access to Medicare Part D Act of 2006" extends the enrollment period for Medicare prescription drug benefits and MA plans by one year. The Act "Improving Access to Medicare Part D Act of 2006" extends the enrollment period for Medicare prescription drug benefits and MA plans by one year, with specific date changes and amendments to the Social Security Act. The Act "Improving Access to Medicare Part D Act of 2006" extends the enrollment period for Medicare prescription drug benefits and MA plans by one year, with specific date changes and amendments to the Social Security Act, including adjustments to clauses and subparagraphs for the years 2006 and 2007. The Act "Improving Access to Medicare Part D Act of 2006" extends the enrollment period for Medicare prescription drug benefits and MA plans by one year, with specific date changes and amendments to the Social Security Act, including adjustments to clauses and subparagraphs for the years 2006 and 2007. In 2007, continuous open enrollment and disenrollment are allowed for the first 6 months for Medicare Advantage eligible individuals. The Act allows individuals to change their election once, except during annual coordinated elections or special enrollment periods. Amendments are made to Section 1860D-1(b) of the Act. The amendments made to Section 1860D-1(b) of the Act involve changes to the annual coordinated open election period described in clauses of section 1851(e)(3)(B). The effective date of these amendments is retroactive to the enactment of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003. SEC. 3. The Secretary is authorized to negotiate fair prices for Medicare prescription drugs on behalf of beneficiaries to ensure the lowest possible costs. SEC. 4. Congress supports improved outreach and education for the Medicare prescription drug benefit. The Secretary of Health and Human Services should conduct activities to raise awareness, improve education, enhance outreach, and provide accessibility of experts for individuals eligible for Medicare prescription drug benefits.
